items.summery: It will be the foremost duty of the Head of each institution/school to get the form filled up from the eligible students of their respective institutions falling within their respective jurisdiction and will process the matter further in time bound manner.

items.title: Thakur Sen negi utkrisht Chatravriti Yojana
items.summery: With this scheme students who are unable to continue studies even after being meritorious will get opportunity to continue study in higher standard.

items.summery: The objective of this scholarship helps girl students from lower-income families to continue their schooling in Maharashtra.

items.title: Prime Minister Awaas Yojana - Gramin
items.summery: The main objective of the PM Awas Yojana Scheme is housing that is affordable for all by the year 2022.

items.title: Women Helpline Scheme
items.summery: The Women Helpline is intended to provide 24 hours immediate and emergency response to women affected by violence through referral linking with appropriate authority such as police, One Stop Centre, hospital.

items.title: Working Women Hostel
items.summery: Provides information about the SakhiNiwas– Working Women Hostel scheme of Ministry of Women and Child Development

items.title: Dhanalakshmi Scheme
items.summery: The scheme aimed at doing away with child marriage by offering parents an attractive insurance cover, and encouraging parents to educate their children as well as covering certain medical expenses for girl babies.

items.title: Janani Shishu Suraksha Karyakaram (JSSK)
items.summery: The scheme is for pregnant women to access Government health facilities for their delivery.

items.title: Chiranjeevi Yojana
items.summery: An innovative partnership with the private sector obstetricians to provide skilled care at birth to the poor in Gujarat

items.title: Rashtriya Kishor Swasthya Karyakram (RKSK)
items.summery: The Rashtriya Kishor Swasthya Karyakram was launched on the 7th January, 2014. The programme envisions enabling all adolescents in India to realize their full potential by making informed and responsible decisions related to their health and well-being and by accessing the services and support they need to do so.

items.title: Kasturba Poshan Sahay Yojana (KPSY)
items.summery: The objective of this study was to assess the Kasturba Poshan Sahay Yojana. The specific objectives were (i) To assess the health services provided to the beneficiary of Kasturba Poshan Sahay Yojana. (ii) To assess the expenditure/utilization of money provided to KPSY beneficiaries. (iii) To assess the awareness and knowledge of beneficiaries about Kasturba Poshan Sahay Yojana.

items.title: State Assisted Scheme Of Provident Fund For Unorganised Sector.
items.summery: The Department of Labour seeks to enforce labour laws and also facilitate the worker’s fundamental rights at their workplace. Let us look in detail about the SASPFUW scheme.

items.title: Udiyaman Swanirbhar Karmasansthan Prakalpa(USKP)
items.summery: The objective of the Scheme is to assist validly registered unemployed youth to take up economically viable projects by providing subsidy from the state government and credit on easy terms from banks and financial institutions.

items.title: Udiyaman Swanirbhar Karmasansthan Prakalpa (USKP)
items.summery: Scheme of West Bengal to assist validly registered unemployed youth to take up economically viable projects.

items.title: Atal Pension Yojana
items.summery: The Co-contributory Pension Scheme by Department of Financial Services aims to encourage people from the unorganised sector to voluntarily save for their retirement and to lower the cost of operations of the New Pension System (NPS) for such subscribers.

items.title: Prime Minister's scheme for RPF/RPSF
items.summery: It was introduced to encourage higher technical and professional education for the dependent wards of Ex/Serving RPF/RPSF personnel and widows (below the Rank of Gazetted officer).

items.title: Prime Minister's scholarship scheme for Central Armed Police Forces and Assam Rifles.
items.summery: Prime Minister’s Scholarship Scheme seeks  to encourage higher technical & professional education for the dependent wards & widows of Central Armed Police Forces & Assam Rifles (CAPFs & AR) Personnel.

items.title: Scholarships for College and University Students
items.summery: Scheme to provide financial assistance to meritorious students to pursue higher studies.

items.title: National Fellowship and Scholarship for Higher Education of ST Students
items.summery: Provides information about National Fellowship and Scholarship for Higher Education of ST Students  (Formally Top Class Education for Schedule Tribe Students).

items.title: National Scheme of Incentive to Girls for Secondary Education
items.summery: It aims to promote enrollment of girl child in the age group of 14-18 at secondary stage.

items.title: National Means Cum Merit Scholarship
items.summery: The objective of the scheme is to award scholarships to meritorious students of economically weaker sections to encourage them to continue the study at secondary stage.

items.title: Integrated Rural Development Program (IRDP) - Himachal Pradesh.
items.summery: The main objective of this scholarship is to give financial help to the BPL families so that their children can continue their studies.

items.title: Maharishi Balmiki Chatravriti Yojana - Himachal Pradesh
items.summery: The scholarship is being offered by the Government of Himachal Pradesh. It invites applications form girl students of Balmiki family engaged in unclean occupation for Maharishi Balmiki Chatravriti Yojana 2019, Himachal Pradesh. The students studying beyond matric level up to college level in a government/private college in Himachal Pradesh.

items.title: Centrally Sponsored Post-Matric Scholarship scheme for ST students -Himachal Pradesh.
items.summery: To provide financial assistance to the Scheduled Tribe students studying at post matriculation or post-secondary stage to enable them to complete their education.

items.title: Victim Rehabilitation Scheme
items.summery: In this scheme, compensation shall be given to victims for treatment, housing, destruction of crops, education, income generating activities and rape cases

items.title: Empowerment Scheme of Bhamashah Yojana
items.summery: The objective of financial inclusion of women and their empowerment, the Rajasthan Bhamashah Yojana was initially launched in the year 2008, when around 50 lakh women applied, and only 29 lakh accounts could be opened at the time. The project aims to make women financially independent and provide the benefits of multiple other schemes through the Bhamashah Card Yojana.

items.title: Empowerment Scheme of Bhamashah Yojana
items.summery: The objective of financial inclusion of women and their empowerment, the Rajasthan Bhamashah Yojana was initially launched in the year 2008, when around 50 lakh women applied, and only 29 lakh accounts could be opened at the time. The project aims to make women financially independent and provide the benefits of multiple other schemes through the Bhamashah Card Yojana.

items.title: Bhamashah Yojana
items.summery: A scheme of Rajasthan government for women empowerment.

items.title: Financial Assistance for Education of the Wards of Beedi/Cine/IOMC/LSDM Workers - Pre-Matric
items.summery: The Main objective of this scheme is to ensure that no child is working in any hazardous sector as labour.

items.title: Top Class Education Scheme for SC Students
items.summery: The scheme aims to recognizing and promoting quality education amongst students belonging to SCs.

items.title: Scholarships for Top Class Education for Students with Disabilities
items.summery: Aims to recognizing and promoting quality education amongst students with disabilities by providing full financial support.

items.title: Pre Matric Scholarships Scheme for Minorities
items.summery: Provides information on scheme that promotes education among minorities
